fields.name: Checkerboard Biscuits
fields.description:
STEP 1
Line a baking sheet with baking parchment. Lightly dust a clean work surface with flour and divide the dough into two. Beat the red food colouring into one batch of dough in a bowl using electric beaters until it’s vibrant red. Divide both lots of dough into two pieces each and chill them for 15 mins.

STEP 2
On the dusted work surface, roll out into four 1cm-thick rectangles, keeping them as straight-edged as possible – a dough scraper or palette knife can help with this. Lay the sheets of dough on top of each other, alternating colours and chill in the fridge until firm, around 30 mins. Trim the edges and cut into strips 1cm thick, then lay the strips on top of each other, alternating the colours, so that a red strip sits on top of plain and vice versa, and brushing lightly with a bit of water to help them stick. Put on a baking tray and chill in the fridge for 1 hr.

STEP 3
Heat the oven to 200C/180C fan/gas 6 and line two large baking sheets with baking parchment. Using a very sharp knife, cut into squares and lightly brush the edges with water. Dip the edges in the demerara sugar then arrange on a baking tray. Bake for 8-10 mins until golden and set. Leave to cool on the tray for 10 mins, before removing to a wire rack to cool completely. Will keep in an airtight container for three days.

fields.name: Crunchy Cornflake Chicken
fields.description:
If baking, preheat an oven to 180°C (350°F)
In a bowl, add the flour and season lightly with salt and pepper. Mix slightly.
Add the eggs to a separate bowl and beat together.
Lastly, add the crushed cornflakes to a third bowl.
One by one, first coat the chicken in the flour, then into the eggs and lastly in the cornflakes.
The chicken should be well covered in the cornflakes, once done, put to the side.
Repeat until you’re out of chicken.
Place on a lightly greased baking tray and bake for 15 minutes or until the chicken is cooked all the way through. Turning halfway through cooking will help guarantee they will cook evenly.
Serve & Enjoy.

fields.name: Spaghetti Bolognese
fields.description:
STEP 1
Put a large saucepan on a medium heat and add 1 tbsp olive oil.

STEP 2
Add 4 finely chopped bacon rashers and fry for 10 mins until golden and crisp.

STEP 3
Reduce the heat and add the 2 onions, 2 carrots, 2 celery sticks, 2 garlic cloves and the leaves from 2-3 sprigs rosemary, all finely chopped, then fry for 10 mins. Stir the veg often until it softens.

STEP 4
Increase the heat to medium-high, add 500g beef mince and cook stirring for 3-4 mins until the meat is browned all over.

STEP 5
Add 2 tins plum tomatoes, the finely chopped leaves from ¾ small pack basil, 1 tsp dried oregano, 2 bay leaves, 2 tbsp tomato purée, 1 beef stock cube, 1 deseeded and finely chopped red chilli (if using), 125ml red wine and 6 halved cherry tomatoes. Stir with a wooden spoon, breaking up the plum tomatoes.

STEP 6
Bring to the boil, reduce to a gentle simmer and cover with a lid. Cook for 1 hr 15 mins stirring occasionally, until you have a rich, thick sauce.

STEP 7
Add the 75g grated parmesan, check the seasoning and stir.

STEP 8
When the bolognese is nearly finished, cook 400g spaghetti following the pack instructions.

STEP 9
Drain the spaghetti and either stir into the bolognese sauce, or serve the sauce on top. Serve with more grated parmesan, the remaining basil leaves and crusty bread, if you like.

fields.name: Salmon and Lentil Stuffed Bell Peppers
fields.description:
Cook lentils and flake salmon.
Sauté onions and garlic in olive oil.
Mix lentils, salmon, sautéed onions, and garlic.
Stuff bell peppers with the mixture.
Bake until peppers are tender.

fields.name: Oats and Banana Breakfast Smoothie
fields.description:
Blend oats until fine.
Add bananas, Greek yogurt, and milk to the blender.
Blend until smooth.
Sweeten with honey if desired.

fields.name: Chocolate Banana Muffins
fields.description:
Mash bananas and mix with sugar, eggs, and milk.
In a separate bowl, combine flour and baking powder.
Mix wet and dry ingredients, fold in chocolate chips.
Pour into muffin cups and bake until golden.

fields.name: Spinach and feta Omelette
fields.description:
Whisk eggs and season with salt and pepper.
Sauté spinach in olive oil until wilted.
Pour eggs over spinach, add crumbled feta, and cook until set.
Fold and serve.

fields.name: Greek Yogurt and Berry Parfait
fields.description:
Layer Greek yogurt, sliced strawberries, sliced bananas, and granola.
Repeat layers.
Drizzle with honey and serve.

fields.name: Lentil and Vegetable Soup
fields.description:
Sauté onions and garlic in olive oil.
Add diced carrots, celery, and tomatoes.
Pour in vegetable broth and add lentils and spices.
Simmer until lentils are tender.

fields.name: Pizza con Pollo
fields.description:
1.
Crumble the yeast and dissolve it in 200 ml of lukewarm water. Process the flour, yeast water, 3 tablespoons of oil and 1 teaspoon of salt with the dough hook of the hand mixer to a smooth dough. Cover and in a warm place Let rise for approx. 1 hour.
2.
Peel the shallot and cut into fine pieces. Heat 1 tablespoon of oil in a saucepan. Sauté the shallot in it for 1–2 minutes. Add the tomatoes and cover Simmer for about 6 minutes over low heat. Season with salt, pepper and sugar. Clean, wash and blanch in boiling salted water for about 2 minutes, drain and drain well3.
Wash the meat, pat dry. Season with salt and pepper. Heat 1 tablespoon of oil in a pan. Fry the meat in it, turning over a medium heat, for about 8 minutes, remove. 2–3 minutes before the end of the cooking time, drizzle the meat with 1 teaspoon of pesto
4.
Roll out the dough on a floured work surface in a round shape (approx. 26 cm Ø). Place the dough on a baking sheet lined with baking paper and brush with the tomato sauce. Cut the mozzarella into slices. Top the pizza with snow peas and mozzarella. Bake in a preheated oven (electric stove: 200 ° C / convection: 175 ° C / gas: see manufacturer) for about 10 minutes
5.
Wash the rocket and drain well to let. Take the pizza out of the oven. Thinly slice the chicken. Spread the rocket and chicken slices on the pizza and drizzle with a little pesto
6.
Wait approx. 35 minutes

fields.name: Honey Glazed Salmon with Roasted Vegetables
fields.description:
Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C).
In a small bowl, whisk together honey, soy sauce, olive oil, minced garlic, and Dijon mustard.
Place salmon fillets on a baking sheet and brush them with the honey glaze.
Toss diced sweet potatoes and halved Brussels sprouts in the remaining glaze and spread them around the salmon.
Season with salt and pepper.
Roast in the oven for 15-20 minutes or until the salmon is cooked through and the vegetables are tender.
Serve the Honey Glazed Salmon with Roasted Vegetables over a bed of quinoa.

fields.name: Spinach and Feta Stuffed Chicken Breast
fields.description:
Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
In a pan, heat olive oil over medium heat. Add minced garlic and sauté until fragrant.
Add chopped spinach to the pan and cook until wilted.
Butterfly each chicken breast and stuff them with the sautéed spinach and crumbled feta.
Secure the stuffed chicken breasts with toothpicks, if needed.
Season the stuffed chicken breasts with salt and pepper.
Bake in the preheated oven for 25-30 minutes or until the chicken is cooked through.
Remove toothpicks before serving.

fields.name: Oats and Banana Pancakes
fields.description:
In a blender, combine oats, mashed banana, eggs, milk, baking powder, and cinnamon. Blend until smooth.
Heat a griddle or non-stick skillet over medium heat.
Pour pancake batter onto the griddle, forming small pancakes.
Cook until bubbles form on the surface, then flip and cook the other side.
Serve with maple syrup and sliced bananas.

fields.name: Strawberry Yogurt Popsicles
fields.description:
Blend strawberries, Greek yogurt, and honey until smooth.
Pour the mixture into popsicle molds.
Freeze until solid.
Unmold and savor these refreshing Strawberry Yogurt Popsicles.

fields.name: Classic Chocolate Chip Cookies
fields.description:
Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C). Line baking sheets with parchment paper.

In a large mixing bowl, cream together the softened butter, granulated sugar, and brown sugar until the mixture is light and fluffy.

Add the eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition. Stir in the vanilla extract.

In a separate bowl, whisk together the all-purpose flour, baking soda, and salt.

Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients, mixing just until combined.

Fold in the chocolate chips and nuts (if using) until evenly distributed throughout the dough.

Drop rounded tablespoons of dough onto the prepared baking sheets, spacing them about 2 inches apart.

Bake in the preheated oven for 9 to 11 minutes or until the edges are golden but the centers are still soft.

Allow the cookies to cool on the baking sheets for a few minutes before transferring them to wire racks to cool completely.

Enjoy these classic chocolate chip cookies with a glass of milk or your favorite beverage!

fields.name: Spaghetti code
fields.description:
Start by creating a new file with a misleading name to keep everyone guessing about its purpose.

Sprinkle unclear variable names generously throughout the code. Use single-letter variables for added confusion.

Mix inconsistent indentation thoroughly. Feel free to use a combination of spaces and tabs for that extra flavor.

Add unnecessary comments sparingly. Place them randomly to distract anyone trying to understand the logic.

Peel redundant code blocks and scatter them across different sections. Make sure to include functions that are never called.

In a separate bowl, blend global variables until they are indistinguishable from local ones.

Season with overly complex conditional statements. Nest them to create a labyrinth of logic.

Unravel the nested loops and intertwine them in a way that makes it impossible to trace the program flow.

Spritz obscure function calls generously. Bonus points for functions defined in other files.

Garnish with a dash of magic numbers and a heap of code copy-pasted directly from Stack Overflow.

Bake the code in the hottest coding environment available, ensuring that it's nearly impossible to debug.

Serve the Spaghetti Code surprise to your unsuspecting colleagues or successors. Watch as they attempt to refactor and understand the tangled masterpiece.

fields.name: Quinoa and Avocado Salad
fields.description:
Cook quinoa according to package instructions.
Dice ripe avocados and mix with cooked quinoa.
Add cherry tomatoes, black beans, and chopped cilantro.
Drizzle with olive oil and lime juice, season with salt and pepper.
Toss gently and refrigerate for 30 minutes before serving.

fields.name: Veggie Stir-Fry with Tofu
fields.description:
Press tofu to remove excess water and cut into cubes.
Sauté mixed vegetables (bell peppers, broccoli, carrots) in sesame oil.
Add tofu and stir-fry until golden brown.
Mix soy sauce, garlic, and ginger, pour over the stir-fry.
Serve over brown rice or noodles.

fields.name: Greek Chickpea Salad
fields.description:
Combine canned chickpeas, cherry tomatoes, cucumber, and feta cheese.
Toss with olive oil, lemon juice, and oregano.
Season with salt and pepper.
Chill in the fridge for an hour before serving.

fields.name: Berry Overnight Oats
fields.description:
In a jar, mix rolled oats, yogurt, and almond milk.
Add mixed berries (strawberries, blueberries, raspberries).
Sweeten with honey or maple syrup.
Refrigerate overnight.
Top with sliced almonds before serving.

fields.name: Spinach and Feta Omelette
fields.description:
Whisk eggs and pour into a heated non-stick pan.
Add spinach, diced tomatoes, and crumbled feta.
Fold the omelette and cook until the eggs are set.
Season with salt and pepper.
Garnish with fresh herbs (parsley or chives).

fields.name: Peanut Butter Banana Smoothie
fields.description:
Blend frozen banana, peanut butter, Greek yogurt, and almond milk.
Add a handful of ice cubes for a refreshing texture.
Sweeten with a touch of honey if desired.
Pour into a glass and enjoy!

fields.name: Veggie Hummus Wraps
fields.description:
Spread a thin layer of hummus on a whole-grain tortilla.
Add sliced cucumbers, bell peppers, cherry tomatoes, and shredded carrots.
Sprinkle with feta cheese and a pinch of black pepper.
Roll up the tortilla tightly and cut into bite-sized pieces.

fields.name: Avocado Toast with Radishes
fields.description:
Toast whole-grain bread slices.
Spread mashed avocado on the toasted bread.
Top with thinly sliced radishes.
Drizzle with olive oil and sprinkle with sea salt.
Garnish with microgreens or fresh herbs.

fields.name: Greek Yogurt Parfait
fields.description:
In a glass, layer Greek yogurt, granola, and mixed berries.
Repeat the layers until the glass is filled.
Drizzle honey on top for sweetness.
Garnish with mint leaves or chopped nuts.

fields.name: Quinoa Chocolate Pudding
fields.description:
Cook quinoa according to package instructions.
In a blender, combine cooked quinoa, chocolate, almond milk, and sugar.
Blend until smooth and creamy.
Chill in the refrigerator for at least 2 hours before serving.
Garnish with sliced strawberries before serving.

fields.name: Avocado Banana Smoothie Bowl
fields.description:
Blend together avocados, bananas, Greek yogurt, honey, and a splash of milk until smooth.
Pour the smoothie into a bowl.
Top with sliced strawberries, bananas, and a drizzle of honey.
Optional: Add a sprinkle of shredded coconut or granola.

fields.name: Mediterranean Chickpea Salad
fields.description:
In a large bowl, combine chickpeas, cherry tomatoes, cucumber, feta cheese, and black olives.
Drizzle olive oil over the salad and toss gently.
Season with salt, pepper, and a squeeze of lemon juice.
Serve chilled and garnish with fresh parsley.

fields.name: Banana Chocolate Chip Muffins
fields.description:
Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C) and line a muffin tin with paper liners.
In a bowl, mix mashed bananas, flour, sugar, baking powder, and a pinch of salt.
Fold in chocolate chips.
Spoon the batter into muffin cups and bake for 20-25 minutes or until a toothpick comes out clean.
Allow to cool before serving.

fields.name: Spiced Roasted Chickpeas
fields.description:
Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C).
Rinse and pat dry chickpeas.
Toss chickpeas with olive oil, smoked paprika, cumin, and a pinch of cayenne.
Spread chickpeas on a baking sheet and roast for 25-30 minutes until crispy.
Cool before serving as a crunchy snack.

fields.name: Berry Parfait with Almond Granola
fields.description:
In a glass, layer Greek yogurt with mixed berries and sliced strawberries.
Top each layer with a sprinkle of homemade almond granola.
Repeat the layers and finish with a drizzle of honey.
Serve chilled for a refreshing breakfast.

fields.name: Grilled Salmon with Lemon-Dill Sauce
fields.description:
Marinate salmon fillets in a mixture of olive oil, lemon juice, minced garlic, and chopped fresh dill.
Grill salmon for 4-5 minutes per side or until it flakes easily with a fork.
Prepare a sauce with Greek yogurt, lemon zest, and additional dill.
Serve grilled salmon with the lemon-dill sauce and a side of steamed broccoli.

fields.name: Avocado & Tomato Salsa
fields.description:
Dice avocados and tomatoes.
Mix with finely chopped red onions, cilantro, lime juice, and a pinch of salt.
Serve the avocado and tomato salsa with whole-grain tortilla chips.

fields.name: Gourmet Stuffed Chicken Breast
fields.description:
Butterfly the chicken breasts and fill with a mixture of sautéed spinach, feta, and sun-dried tomatoes.
Secure the breasts with toothpicks and bake until golden brown.
Serve over a bed of quinoa, drizzled with balsamic glaze.

fields.name: Decadent Chocolate Mousse
fields.description:
Elevate your dessert game with this decadent chocolate mousse.

Melt dark chocolate and let it cool.
Whip heavy cream until stiff peaks form.
Gently fold the melted chocolate into the whipped cream.
Chill for at least 4 hours before serving.

fields.name: Seared Beef Tenderloin with Red Wine Reduction
fields.description:
Impress your guests with this elegant beef tenderloin dish.

Season beef tenderloin with salt and pepper.
Sear on high heat for a nice crust, then finish in the oven.
In the same pan, create a red wine reduction with onions and beef broth.
Slice the beef and drizzle with the rich red wine reduction.

fields.name: Quinoa and Kale Power Bowl
fields.description:
Cook Quinoa: Rinse quinoa thoroughly. In a saucepan, combine quinoa with double the amount of water. Bring to a boil, then simmer until water is absorbed and quinoa is tender. Fluff with a fork.

Prepare Kale: Wash kale leaves and remove stems. Chop into bite-sized pieces. In a pan, sauté chopped garlic in olive oil until golden. Add kale and sauté until wilted but still vibrant.

Poach Eggs: Bring a pot of water to a gentle simmer. Create a whirlpool in the water and carefully drop in eggs one at a time. Poach for 3-4 minutes for a runny yolk.

Assemble Bowl: In serving bowls, layer cooked quinoa, sautéed kale, and a poached egg. Top with sliced avocado and drizzle with balsamic glaze.

Serve: Garnish with salt and pepper to taste. Serve immediately, mixing the runny egg yolk into the bowl for added creaminess.

fields.name: Salmon and Lentil Salad
fields.description:
Pan-Seared Salmon: Season salmon fillets with salt and pepper. In a hot pan with olive oil, sear salmon for 3-4 minutes on each side until golden and cooked through.

Prepare Lentil Salad: Cook lentils according to package instructions. Let them cool. In a bowl, combine lentils, halved cherry tomatoes, and diced cucumber.

Make Lemon Vinaigrette: In a small bowl, whisk together lemon juice, olive oil, salt, and pepper. Adjust to taste.

Combine and Serve: Flake the pan-seared salmon over the lentil salad. Drizzle the lemon vinaigrette over the top. Toss gently to combine.

Serve: Divide into serving plates. Garnish with fresh herbs if desired. Serve immediately.

fields.name: Chicken and Broccoli Stir-Fry
fields.description:
Prepare Ingredients: Slice chicken into thin strips. Cut broccoli into florets. Julienne carrots and bell peppers. Mince garlic and ginger.

Stir-Fry Chicken: In a wok or large pan, heat oil over high heat. Stir-fry chicken until browned and cooked through. Remove from the pan.

Cook Vegetables: In the same pan, add more oil if needed. Sauté garlic and ginger until fragrant. Add broccoli, carrots, and bell peppers. Stir-fry until vegetables are tender-crisp.

Make Sauce: In a small bowl, mix soy sauce. Pour over the vegetables. Add the cooked chicken back to the pan. Stir until everything is coated and heated through.

Serve Over Rice: Serve the stir-fry over cooked brown rice.

fields.name: Chocolate Banana Bread Pudding
fields.description:
Prepare Ingredients: Preheat the oven to 350°F (180°C). Cube bread, chop chocolate, and slice bananas.

Create Bread Mixture: In a bowl, combine cubed bread, chopped chocolate, and sliced bananas.

Make Custard: In another bowl, whisk together milk, eggs, and sugar until well combined.

Combine and Bake: Pour the custard mixture over the bread mixture. Allow it to soak for 15 minutes. Transfer to a baking dish and bake for 40-45 minutes or until the center is set.

Serve: Allow the pudding to cool slightly before serving. Optionally, dust with powdered sugar or serve with a scoop of vanilla ice cream.

fields.name: Spicy Chickpea and Almond Mix
fields.description:
Roast Chickpeas and Almonds: Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C). Toss chickpeas and almonds with your favorite spices.

Bake: Spread the chickpeas and almonds on a baking sheet. Roast in the oven for 20-25 minutes or until golden and crispy.

Cool and Serve: Allow the spicy chickpea and almond mix to cool before serving. Store in an airtight container for a crunchy snack.

fields.name: Avocado and Tomato Breakfast Sandwich
fields.description:
Mash Avocado: Mash the avocado and spread it on toasted whole wheat English muffins.

Prepare Eggs: Cook eggs to your liking (poached, scrambled, or fried).

Assemble Sandwich: Layer sliced tomatoes, eggs, and crumbled feta cheese on the avocado-covered English muffins.

Season: Sprinkle with salt and pepper to taste. Optionally, add hot sauce for some heat.

Serve: Put the halves together to create a delicious and nutritious breakfast sandwich.

fields.name: Quinoa Salad with Grilled Chicken
fields.description:
Cook Quinoa: Prepare quinoa according to package instructions. Let it cool.

Grill Chicken: Grill seasoned chicken until fully cooked. Slice into strips.

Chop Vegetables: Dice bell peppers and cucumber. Crumble feta cheese.

Assemble Salad: In a large bowl, combine cooked quinoa, grilled chicken, diced bell peppers, cucumber, and feta cheese.

Make Dressing: Whisk together olive oil and lemon juice. Drizzle over the salad and toss to combine.

Serve: Divide into bowls, and enjoy a refreshing and protein-packed lunch.

fields.name: Beef and Vegetable Stir-Fry with Brown Rice
fields.description:
Slice Beef: Cut beef into thin strips.

Stir-Fry Beef: In a wok or pan, heat sesame oil. Stir-fry beef until browned. Remove from the pan.

Cook Vegetables: In the same pan, stir-fry broccoli, carrots, and snap peas until tender-crisp. Add minced ginger.

Combine Ingredients: Add the cooked beef back to the pan. Pour soy sauce over the mixture. Stir until everything is coated.

Serve Over Rice: Serve the beef and vegetable stir-fry over cooked brown rice.

fields.name: Raspberry Chocolate Mousse
fields.description:
Melt Chocolate: Melt dark chocolate over a double boiler. Let it cool slightly.

Whip Cream: In a separate bowl, whip heavy cream until stiff peaks form.

Make Chocolate Mousse: Gently fold melted chocolate into the whipped cream until smooth.

Prepare Raspberry Sauce: Blend raspberries with sugar to create a sauce.

Layer Dessert: In serving glasses, alternate layers of chocolate mousse and raspberry sauce.

Chill and Garnish: Refrigerate for at least 2 hours. Garnish with fresh raspberries and mint leaves before serving.

fields.name: Mediterranean Hummus Platter
fields.description:
Assemble Platter: Spread hummus on a large platter.

Arrange Ingredients: Place cherry tomatoes, sliced cucumber, Kalamata olives, and crumbled feta cheese on top of the hummus.

Serve with Pita: Warm pita bread and serve alongside the platter.

fields.name: Oatmeal and Banana Pancakes
fields.description:
Blend Batter: In a blender, combine oats, bananas, milk, eggs, baking powder, and honey. Blend until smooth.

Cook Pancakes: Heat a griddle or pan. Pour batter onto the hot surface to form pancakes. Cook until bubbles appear, then flip and cook the other side.

Stack and Serve: Stack the pancakes and drizzle with honey. Optionally, add sliced bananas on top.

fields.name: Lemon Herb Grilled Salmon
fields.description:
Prepare Marinade: In a bowl, mix olive oil, minced garlic, chopped fresh dill, lemon juice, salt, and pepper.

Marinate Salmon: Coat salmon fillets with the marinade and let them sit for at least 30 minutes.

Grill Salmon: Grill the marinated salmon fillets until they are cooked through and have a nice char.

Garnish and Serve: Squeeze fresh lemon juice over the grilled salmon and garnish with additional dill. Serve with your favorite side dishes.

fields.name: Dark Chocolate and Raspberry Tart
fields.description:
Prepare Tart Crust: Mix flour, melted butter, and sugar. Press the mixture into a tart pan and bake until golden brown.

Melt Chocolate: Melt dark chocolate and pour it over the cooled tart crust.

Arrange Raspberries: Place fresh raspberries on top of the melted chocolate.

Chill and Serve: Allow the tart to chill in the refrigerator for at least 2 hours before serving. Slice and enjoy!

fields.name: Caprese Skewers with Balsamic Glaze
fields.description:
Assemble Skewers: Thread cherry tomatoes, fresh mozzarella balls, and basil leaves onto skewers.

Drizzle with Olive Oil: Arrange the skewers on a serving platter and drizzle with olive oil.

Season: Sprinkle with salt and pepper to taste.

Serve with Balsamic Glaze: Drizzle balsamic glaze over the skewers just before serving. Enjoy this refreshing and easy-to-make snack.

fields.name: Banana Nut Overnight Oats
fields.description:
Combine Ingredients: In a jar, mix oats, milk, sliced bananas, Greek yogurt, honey, and chopped walnuts.

Stir Well: Stir the mixture until well combined, ensuring oats are fully coated.

Refrigerate Overnight: Cover the jar and refrigerate overnight or for at least 4 hours.

Serve: The next morning, give the oats a good stir and enjoy a delicious and nutritious breakfast.
